conclusion: Analyze paths liquid will take from A, B, C, and D to containers E, F, or G.
Liquid flows down from A and encounters a yellow baffle.
Liquid from A flows to the right through yellow baffle into container E.
Liquid flows down from B and encounters an orange baffle.
Liquid from B flows to the right through orange baffle into container E.
Liquid flows down from C and encounters a light blue baffle.
Liquid from C flows to the right through light blue baffle into container F.
Liquid flows down from D and encounters a blue baffle.
Liquid from D flows to the right through blue baffle into container F.
Liquid from A and B flows into container E; liquid from C and D flows into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from A and B flows into container E; liquid from C and D flows into container F; container G receives no liquid.
